elements.title: St. Patrick's Cathedral (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that New York City's St. Patrick's Cathedral (pictured), praised upon completion as the "finest church edifice on the American continent", was funded mostly by poor Irish Catholic parishioners?

elements.title: Olaf's Frozen Adventure (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Olaf's Frozen Adventure was removed from exhibition in Mexico following complaints about its length?

elements.title: Bailey Wightman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the English-Australian cricketer Bailey Wightman made his County debut for Kent whilst playing club cricket for Tunbridge Wells after an outbreak of COVID-19?

elements.title: more than 9,000 local government entities (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Minnesota went from having more than 9,000 local government entities in 1952 to having fewer than 4,000 in 2012?

elements.title: Chuck McMann (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Chuck McMann led the McGill Redmen football team to five playoff appearances in his six seasons as head coach?

elements.title: give women the right to stand for parliament (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that South Australia became the first place in the world to give women the right to stand for parliament due to an opponent's "great miscalculation"?

elements.title: Anna Sorokin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that while convicted fraudster Anna Sorokin was in jail, one of her visitors was Julia Garner, who will play Sorokin in the Netflix miniseries about her?

elements.title: Duke of Sussex (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Duke of Sussex has been providing drinks in Acton Green for over a century?
